attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxpsDDdd8ILWFmoq0X_description
attribs.current: When you attempt to learn or recall a piece of lore, if you do not know that information, you often know where and from whom you can obtain it. Usually, this information comes from a library, scriptorium, university, or a sage or other learned person or creature, Your DM might rule that the knowledge you seek is secreted away in an almost inaccessible place, or that it simply cannot be found. Unearthing the deepest secrets of the multiverse can require an adventure or even a whole campaign.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxqTu5PIVF47XJ8twZ_description
attribs.current: Thanks to your infernal heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxqTu8dTYXRhpNZeMR_description
attribs.current: You have resistance to fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxqTuBwnEeng4ZGjhU_description
attribs.current: You know the mage hand cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Tenser's floating disk spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the arcane lock spell once with this trait, requiring no material component, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxr3D8jkQx6pmnYjIK_description
attribs.current:
Drawing on the ancient powers of dragons, you can cast spells to shape that essence to your will and express your prowess with the arcane over all others

Cantrips At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from your available spell lists based on your Draconian Origin. You learn additional Dragon Mage cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Dragon Mage table.

Preparing and Casting Spells The Dragon Mage table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these Dragon Mage spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of Dragon Mage spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the Dragon Mage spell list. When you do so, choose a number of Dragon Mage spells equal to your Spell Casting Ability modifier + your Dragon Mage level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level Dragon Mage, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Spellcasting Ability of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell Burning Hands, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

Spellcasting Ability Charisma or Intelligence of your choosing is your spellcasting ability for your Dragon Mage spells, since your magic can draw from the soul of a Dragon and can naturally grow stronger or you can study the arcane and master it through your wits alone. You use one of these abilities whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your spellcasting ability modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Dragon Mage spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence or Charisma modifier (your choice)

Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence or Charisma modifier (your choice)

Ritual Casting You can cast a Dragon Mage spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

Spellcasting Focus You can use an arcane focus or a component as a spellcasting focus for your Dragon Mage spells.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxr3DDC3AZDqCEd280_description
attribs.current:
Beginning at 1st Level you choose one chromatic or metallic dragon; this color dragon will be where your power comes from. You gain features depending on this color. In addition you gain a Spellcasting List depending on the color chosen. You are also able to speak, read, and write Draconic. Some of your Draconian Abilities will require a saving throw, the DC for that will equal your Spell Save DC.

Black You have resistance to acid damage, at 10th level this becomes immunity. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that would deal acid damage, each creature that suffers the effects of the spell must make a Dexterity Saving Throw. On a failed save you can choose either any non-magical armor or a non-magical weapon they are carrying, roll a d100 to determine what happens to said selected item. The higher stages inherit the lower stages’ effects.

1-10 : The item is damaged, the next time they crit fail to attack or a critical hit is imposed onto them the item will break. 

11-20 : The item receives a -2 penalty to either AC or to Attack Rolls. 

21-30 : The item becomes unwieldy, giving them disadvantage on ability checks while holding the weapon or wearing the armor. 

31-40 : The target has disadvantage on attack rolls while wielding the weapon, or disadvantage on saving throws while wearing the armor. 

41-50 : While the item is equipped they suffer a -2 penalty to damage rolls. 

51-60 : While the item is equipped they have disadvantage on Constitution Saving Throws. 

61-70 : While the item is equipped they take 1d6 acid damage at the start of their turns. 

71-80 : In 1 minute, the item will be destroyed as it melts away by the acid. 

81-90 : In 30 seconds, the item will snap in two, becoming either an improvised weapon, or unusable armor. 

91-100 : The item is instantly destroyed and they take 4d6 acid damage.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxr3DHk9r6Zb8gtQEU_description
attribs.current: Being a Dragon Mage, your body is riddled with dragon scales, making your skin tougher. At 1st level While not wearing armor you have a natural armor equal to 13 + your Dexterity Modifier.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxr3DK1KO4RHChWUzw_description
attribs.current: Also at 2nd level you learn the ancient secrets of dragons. You know how they can fly, shoot fire - lighting - acid - even frost out of their mouths. You start off with 3 Draconian Powers and gain more as shown in the Dragon Mage table. Some Draconian Powers are locked away by prerequisites that must be met before they obtain any of these sacred powers such as level and Draconian Origins. You can exchange a Draconian Power for others every time you level up.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxr3DNCNtKNtRqLJ0s_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 3rd level, as an action you can awaken ancient powers from within, maximizing your magical prowess. Once your Draconian Awakening ends, you suffer 1 level of exhaustion and cannot cast spells for 1 round. You cannot use this transformation again until you finish a long rest. You gain more uses of this feature per long rest at 7th, 13th, and 17th levels. When you transform, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute :

- You gain advantage on Saving Throws against spells and other magical effects, including a Dragon’s Breath Weapon.

- If you have a flying speed, it increases by 30 ft. If you do not have a flying speed, you gain a flying speed of 40 ft. Until you reach 5th level, you cannot end your turn airborne, any attempt to do so causes you to fall.

- You reduce the amount of damage you take from spells and other magical effects by 1d10. You can only do so once per round.

- You increase the amount of damage dealt by your spells and other magical effects by 1d10. You can only do so once per round.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxr3DRMYLSZG6UhyPI_description
attribs.current:
At 5th level, you have learned to regain some of your magical energy by pulling power out from the depths of your draconian soul. Once per day, when you complete a short rest, you regain a single expended spell slot for each spell slot level under 6th you have. You cannot have more spell slots than your maximum.

In addition, you regain a 1st level spell slot for each hit die you spend during your short rest. You cannot have more spell slots than your maximum. You can do this a number of times per day equal to your Spellcasting Ability Modifier, regaining expended uses during the next dawn or dusk whichever is further.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxr3DU81AfMymhPClW_description
attribs.current: At 7th level, Gain another use of Draconian Awakening

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxuUiA3iUD3c0JZ9Od_description
attribs.current: At 1st level, when you cast a Dragon Mage spell that deals damage it gains a bonus to the damage roll equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxukPL-OoVd6VoJNHr_description
attribs.current:
Also at 1st level you have a pool of energy that you’ll use for your Evoker Features called Evoke Energy. You have an amount of Evoke Energy equal to twice your Dragon Mage level. You regain all expended Evoke Energy after a long rest. As a bonus action on your turn you can spend your Evoke Energy to do one of the following effects :

Evoke Destruction
When you cast an evocation spell of 1st level or higher that deals damage, by spending 2 Evoke Energy you deal an additional amount of damage equal to 2 plus the spell’s level. As a result, you lose an amount of hit points equal to the bonus damage dealt.

Evoke Durability
When you cast an evocation spell of 1st level or higher you can spend 2 Evoke Energy to grant allies within 20 ft of you temporary hit points equal to 2 plus the spell’s level.

Evoke Durability
When you cast an evocation spell of 1st level or higher, by spending 2 Evoke Energy allies within 20 ft of you gain advantage on all attack rolls and saving throws until the start of your next turn.

Evoke Speed
When you cast an evocation spell of 1st level or higher, you can spend 2 Evoke Energy to grant you and allies within 20 ft of you an increase to their movement speed by 10 ft.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxvGXlwRg6EtZHDpL3_description
attribs.current:
Beginning at 6th level you can spend an action and 2 Evoke Energy to activate your “Evoke Aura”. Your Aura does not have a duration, however at the start of each of your turns you must spend 2 Evoke Energy to prolong the aura. While the Aura is active you have the following effects :

Each creature you choose within 20 ft of you makes a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, on a failed save they are frightened for as long as the aura lasts, on a success they are immune to this effect for 24 hours. Each affected creature can repeat their save at the end of each of their turns, ending this effect on a success.

Creatures who are frightened of you have disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws against Evocation spells you cast. In addition, creatures frightened of you cannot regain hit points if they are within your Aura’s radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can choose a number of creatures within your aura’s radius up to your spellcasting ability modifier, those creatures gain a number of temporary hit points equal to half your Dragon Mage level.

When the effects of your Evoke Aura ends you suffer 1 level of exhaustion and lose 2d12 hit point. Once you have used your Evoke Aura once, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxx9HIZbTyAHtKuVr3_description
attribs.current:
You have a mind that can track time, direction, and detail with uncanny precision. You gain the following benefits:

- Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

- You always know which way is north.

- You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset.

- You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHxxK67CmKt-qi9Uptg_description
attribs.current:
You awaken to your psionic potential, which enhances your mind or body. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20, to represent this enhancement.

You also harbor a wellspring of psionic power within yourself, an energy that ebbs and flows as you channel it in various ways. This power is represented by your Psionic Talent die, the starting size of which is a d6.

Psionic Talent Options. You can use your Psionic Talent die in the following ways:

- Psi-Boosted Ability. When you make an ability check with the ability increased by this feat, you can roll your Psionic Talent die and add the number rolled to the check. You can choose to do so before or after rolling the d20, but before you know whether the check succeeded or failed.

- Psi-Guided Strike. Once on each of your turns when you hit with an attack roll that uses the ability increased by this feat, you can roll your Psionic Talent die after you make the damage roll and then replace one of the damage dice with the number rolled on the Psionic Talent die.

Changing the Die's Size. If you roll the highest number on your Psionic Talent die, it decreases by one die size after the roll. This represents you burning through your psionic energy. For example, if the die is a d6 and you roll a 6, it becomes a d4. If it's a d4 and you roll a 4, it becomes unusable until you finish a long rest.

Conversely, if you roll a 1 on your Psionic Talent die, it increases by one die size after the roll, up to its starting size. This represents you conserving psionic energy for later use. For example, if you roll a 1 on a d4, the die then becomes a d6.

Whenever you finish a long rest, your Psionic Talent die resets to its starting size. When you reach certain levels, the starting size of your Psionic Talent die increases: at 5th level (d8), 11th level (d10), and 17th level (d12). If you have a Psionic Talent die from another source, such as a class feature, you don't get more than one die; use only the one with the largest starting size.

Psi Replenishment. As a bonus action, you can calm your mind for a moment and restore your Psionic Talent die to its starting size. You then can't use Psi Replenishment again until you finish a long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MHxzsA-gouL36nLDULy_itemcontent
attribs.current:
An arcane focus is a special item—an orb, a crystal, a rod, a specially constructed staff, a wand-like length of wood, or some similar item—designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus.

Multiple variations of this item exist, as listed below:

- Crystal

- Orb

- Rod

- Staff

- Wand

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MHxzspL5I6LrshD83wp_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Finesse. When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

Light. A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

Thrown. If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the finesse property.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MHxzspL5I6LrshD83wp_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: melee weapon, Damage: 1d4, Damage Type: piercing, Range: 20/60

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MHxzu8ulfFPqKe1UWp4_itemcontent
attribs.current: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch. A pouch can hold up to ⅕ cubic foot or 6 pounds of gear.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MHxzuSQspyuR0r7SZjI_itemcontent
attribs.current: Category: Items, Item Type: adventuring gear, Weight: 5, Requires Attunement: No

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MHxzuSTCQoyaaWAWH6F_itemcontent
attribs.current: Category: Items, Item Type: adventuring gear, Weight: 5, Requires Attunement: No

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MHxzuSVOohcxGwFGaJd_itemcontent
attribs.current: Category: Items, Item Type: adventuring gear, Requires Attunement: No

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MHxzuSXMBkK1CvZuo5R_itemcontent
attribs.current: Category: Items, Item Type: adventuring gear, Requires Attunement: No

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MHxzuSZzaHAvHa9ARGv_itemcontent
attribs.current: Category: Items, Item Type: adventuring gear, Requires Attunement: No

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current:
I've read every book in the world's greatest libraries—or I like to boast that I have.
I'm willing to listen to every side of an argument before I make my own judgment.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Knowledge. The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge. (Neutral)

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: My life's work is a series of tomes related to a specific field of lore.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: Most people scream and run when they see a demon. I stop and take notes on its anatomy.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MHyGTKgkM8pGTTNYLAd_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You hurl a bubble of acid. Choose one creature you can see within range, or choose two creatures you can see within range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 acid damage.

This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-MHyGTZv7dAUPWDiRoSu_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You assume a different form. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following options, the effects of which last for the duration of the spell. While the spell lasts, you can end one option as an action to gain the benefits of a different one.

Aquatic Adaptation. You adapt your body to an aquatic environment, sprouting gills and growing webbing between your fingers. You can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Change Appearance. You transform your appearance. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this spell to become quadrupedal, for instance. At any time for the duration of the spell, you can use your action to change your appearance in this way again.

Natural Weapons. You grow claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice. Your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, as appropriate to the natural weapon you chose, and you are proficient with your unarmed strikes. Finally, the natural weapon is magic and you have a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls you make using it.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MHyGTpTNAT9hc49t5tl_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MHyGTpTNAT9hc49t5tl_spelldescription
attribs.current: You attempt to charm a humanoid you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is charmed by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MHyGU5ir-qamnsw3c9A_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: a pinch of soot and salt

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MHyGU5ir-qamnsw3c9A_spelldescription
attribs.current:
For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any spoken language that you hear. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface on which the words are written. It takes about 1 minute to read one page of text.

This spell doesn't decode secret messages in a text or a glyph, such as an arcane sigil, that isn't part of a written language.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MHyGUViYrMHQasp-AOx_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MHyGUViYrMHQasp-AOx_spellcastingtime
attribs.current: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MHyGUViYrMHQasp-AOx_spelldescription
attribs.current: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MHyGUnrHwwRyv8IlT9u_spelldescription
attribs.current:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MHyGVxPdlpmSwRZTO91_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MHyGVxPdlpmSwRZTO91_spelldescription
attribs.current: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-MHyGWTVOrE-QC6qtuEF_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You cause a creature or an object you can see within range to grow larger or smaller for the duration. Choose either a creature or an object that is neither worn nor carried. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect.

If the target is a creature, everything it is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by an affected creature returns to normal size at once.

Enlarge. The target's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases its size by one category—from Medium to Large, for example. If there isn't enough room for the target to double its size, the creature or object attains the maximum possible size in the space available. Until the spell ends, the target also has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also grow to match its new size. While these weapons are enlarged, the target's attacks with them deal 1d4 extra damage.

Reduce. The target's size is halved in all dimensions, and its weight is reduced to one-eighth of normal. This reduction decreases its size by one category—from Medium to Small, for example. Until the spell ends, the target also has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also shrink to match its new size. While these weapons are reduced, the target's attacks with them deal 1d4 less damage (this can't reduce the damage below 1).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-4_-MHyGYQfFNQOZdT7A1NW_spelldescription
attribs.current: You or a creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-MHyGZLarrOGiF66z0ra_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-MHyGZLarrOGiF66z0ra_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: an eyelash encased in gum arabic

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-MHyGZLarrOGiF66z0ra_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MHyGZjUJKBD4GQfpF6g_spelldescription
attribs.current:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MHyGZMZGFmTTLpzSuFr_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of meteors created increases by two for each slot level above 3rd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MHyGZMZGFmTTLpzSuFr_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: niter, sulfur, and pine tar formed into a bead

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MHyGZMZGFmTTLpzSuFr_spelldescription
attribs.current: You create six tiny meteors in your space. They float in the air and orbit you for the spell's duration. When you cast the spell—and as a bonus action on each of your turns thereafter—you can expend one or two of the meteors, sending them streaking toward a point or points you choose within 120 feet of you. Once a meteor reaches its destination or impacts against a solid surface, the meteor explodes. Each creature within 5 feet of the point where the meteor explodes must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MHyGZMZGFmTTLpzSuFr_spelltarget
attribs.current: Each creature within 5 feet of a point or points you choose within 120 feet of you

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MHyGa84pLHOXu1VGqKD_spelldescription
attribs.current:
This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

- You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

- You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

- You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

- You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

- You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

- You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MHyGaTauvFcJFeoET18_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You channel primal magic to cause your teeth or fingernails to sharpen, ready to deliver a corrosive attack. Make a melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 acid damage. After you make the attack, your teeth or fingernails return to normal.

The spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MHyGaTauvFcJFeoET18_spelltarget
attribs.current: One creature within 5 feet of you

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MHyGaqARU0tS3lu-dVC_spellcastingtime
attribs.current: 1 reaction, which you take when you are hit by an attack or targeted by the magic missile spell

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MHyGaqARU0tS3lu-dVC_spelldescription
attribs.current: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-4_-MHyGbBRGlNuH5zXZLh9_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 4th.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-4_-MHyGbBRGlNuH5zXZLh9_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: a drop of giant slug bile

attribs.name: repeating_spell-4_-MHyGbBRGlNuH5zXZLh9_spelldescription
attribs.current: You point at a location within range, and a glowing 1-foot-diameter ball of emerald acid streaks there and explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10d4 acid damage and another 5d4 acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-4_-MHyGbBRGlNuH5zXZLh9_spellsavesuccess
attribs.current: Half damage and no damage at end of turn

attribs.name: repeating_spell-4_-MHyGbBRGlNuH5zXZLh9_spelltarget
attribs.current: Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MHyGbCLeVbnVDqi52rU_saveeffect
attribs.current: Half damage and no damage at end of turn

attribs.name: repeating_spell-4_-MHyGmLDXBWiFZTH682l_spelldescription
attribs.current:
Dim, greenish light spreads within a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The light spreads around corners, and it lasts until the spell ends.

When a creature moves into the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 4d10 radiant damage, and it suffers one level of exhaustion and emits a dim, greenish light in a 5-foot radius. This light makes it impossible for the creature to benefit from being invisible. The light and any levels of exhaustion caused by this spell go away when the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-4_-MHyGmLDXBWiFZTH682l_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature that moves into the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHyILB7I3t0MxG2ZWZ9_description
attribs.current: You can breathe underwater as you do air. In addition, attacks made underwater are made normally as if you were on land.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHyILQn-S01SwF3fXdY_description
attribs.current:
You have advantage on performance and acrobatics checks. You gain proficiency in two musical instruments of your choice. 

As a bonus action you can evoke the power of your Dragonsong for 1 minute. While active, your Dragonsong gives a +2 bonus to your AC and Dexterity Saving throws. You cannot use your Dragonsong again until you finish a long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHyILjI8RWTDSBNIfNd_description
attribs.current: You grow a pair of wings that allows you to fly. You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHyIM37OZd5CrEeYuP3_description
attribs.current: You can conjure a tiny dragon to keep you company. You can ritual cast the “Find Familiar” spell without requiring material components, but you can only summon a Pseudodragon with this feature. The Pseudodragon has the “Familiar” feature when summoned in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHyIMGNmMKeVh69knB0_description
attribs.current: Depending on the Draconian Origin you picked you gain a breath weapon that does 4d6 damage. The number of damage dice increases by 2 at 5th level, and then again at 10th, once more at 15th, and one last time at 20th level. You have a number of uses of this Draconian Power equal to half your Constitution Modifier (rounded down, minimum of 1) and regain all uses of it after a long rest. (Look at the Dragonborn Ancestry to determine the damage type). At 5th level the breath weapon increases to a range of a 30 foot cone or line depending on the type of dragon, 60 feet at 11th level, and 90 feet at 17th. The save DC for this power is 8 + Proficiency Bonus + Constitution.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MHyIMTEdKjlNa4SqhP0_description
attribs.current: You can cast Identify at will without expending a spell slot or requiring a material component, you also do not need to touch the item to identify it.
